detections.label: <<FORMULA_0436>>
detections.error_description: The diameter should be defined using the distance between two points: ||(x_i, T(x_j)) - (x_k, T(x_l))||, not the sum ||(x_i, T(x_j)) + (x_k, T(x_l))||; i.e., the sign between the two terms is incorrect.

detections.label: <<FORMULA_0446>>
detections.error_description: In the diameter definition, the norm term uses '+' in one place (|(x_i, T(x_j)) + (x_k, T(x_l))|) but later uses '-' (|(x_i, T(x_j)) - (x_k, T(x_l))|), i.e., an inconsistent sign (sign flip) in the diameter expression.

detections.label: <<FORMULA_0443>>
detections.error_description: In the definition of \bar{\mathbf{y}}^{(t)}, the summand uses T(\mathbf{x}_{i}) while the summation variable is \mathbf{x}; it should be T(\mathbf{x}) (the index i is undefined in that scope).

detections.label: <<FORMULA_0441>>
detections.error_description: In the definition of diam(Γ_{t,q}), the expression uses a plus inside the norm in one place ( (x_i, T(x_j)) + (x_k, T(x_l)) ) and a minus in another ( (x_i, T(x_j)) - (x_k, T(x_l)) ); this inconsistent change of sign constitutes a sign flip error.

detections.label: <<FORMULA_0447>>
detections.error_description: The inner distance term changes from a difference to a sum between definitions: initially ||(x_i, T(x_j)) - (x_k, T(x_l))||, later ||(x_i, T(x_j)) + (x_k, T(x_l))||, indicating a sign flip inconsistency.

detections.label: <<FORMULA_0452>>
detections.error_description: The diameter definition uses a plus inside the norm: ||(x_i, T(x_j)) + (x_k, T(x_l))||, which should be a difference ||(x_i, T(x_j)) - (x_k, T(x_l))|| to represent a distance. There are also inconsistent diameter definitions (plus vs minus, max vs min) in the excerpt.

detections.label: <<FORMULA_0303>>
detections.error_description: From Tr( tilde{P}^{-1} tilde{P} C^T P ) to Tr( tilde{P} C^T P tilde{P}^T ), the derivation effectively uses tilde{P}^{-1} = tilde{P}^T (orthogonality) to move/insert factors, which is not generally valid. The transpose is introduced where the inverse should be used.

detections.label: <<FORMULA_0453>>
detections.error_description: In the first line, the diameter term uses \\G^Tamma_{t,q} instead of \\Gamma_{t,q}, i.e., an extraneous transpose marker (the ^T) corrupts the symbol and creates inconsistency with the later \\Gamma_{t,q} term.

detections.label: <<FORMULA_0445>>
detections.error_description: In the diameter definition, the norm switches from a sum to a difference between two paired terms (plus inside the norm in one place, minus in another), i.e., a sign-flip error.

detections.label: <<FORMULA_0438>>
detections.error_description: Suspicious subscript ρ_{t×1} (written as ρ_{t\times1}) instead of the intended ρ_t; this index change affects normalization.

detections.label: <<FORMULA_0457>>
detections.error_description: The second equality incorrectly replaces |X_q^{(t)}|^2 and |X_q^{(t-1)}|^2 by (n/ρ_t)^2 and (n/ρ_{t+1})^2, mixing index subscripts and breaking the intended dependence on t. This change in indices makes the claimed equality to 0 invalid.

detections.label: <<FORMULA_0437>>
detections.error_description: In the definition of diam(Γ_{t,q}), the norm uses a sum of two vectors (x_i, T(x_j)) + (x_k, T(x_l)); this should be the difference to measure distance between points, i.e., (x_i, T(x_j)) - (x_k, T(x_l)).

detections.label: <<FORMULA_0539>>
<<FORMULA_0520>>
detections.error_description: Inconsistent subscript: the outer definition uses Γ_m(X) with index j=0..J, while the inner definition uses Γ_j(X); the indices m and j are mismatched (should be Γ_j(X)).

detections.label: <<FORMULA_0545>>
detections.error_description: The cost is defined as a product over all pairs (k,k') of c(x_{j,k}, y_{j,k'}) π_j(x_{j,k}, y_{j,k'}), but the OT cost should be a sum: cost(π_j) = sum_{k, k'} c(x_{j,k}, y_{j,k'}) π_j(x_{j,k}, y_{j,k'}).

detections.label: <<FORMULA_0460>>
detections.formula:
& \int_{\mathsf{X} \times \mathsf{Y}} \lVert T_{\theta}(x) - y \rVert_{2}^{p} (\mathrm{id} \times T)_{\sharp} \sum_{i=1}^{n} \mu_{i} \delta_{x_{i}} \mathrm{d} x \mathrm{d} y = \int_{\mathsf{X} \times \mathsf{Y}} \lVert T_{\theta}(x) - y \rVert_{2}^{p} \sum_{i=1}^{n} \mu_{i} (\mathrm{id} \times T)_{\sharp} \delta_{x_{i}} \mathrm{d}x \mathrm{d}y  \\
    &= \sum_{i=1}^{n} \mu_{i} \int_{\mathsf{X} / \mathsf{Y}} \lVert T_{\theta}(x) - y \rVert_{2}^{p} \delta_{(x_{i}, T(x_{i}))} \mathrm{d}y \mathrm{d}x = \sum_{i=1}^{n} \mu_{i} \lVert T_{\theta}(x_{i}) - T(x_{i}) \rVert_{2}^{p} \, ,

detections.label: <<FORMULA_0540>>
detections.error_description: The denominator uses a product over pi terms (\prod) instead of a sum, effectively swapping a sum with a product and yielding a non-normalized weighted average. It should be a sum (or proper normalization) of the weights π, not a product.

detections.label: <<FORMULA_0454>>
detections.error_description: In the definition of diameter Γ_{t,q}, the expression toggles from using the norm of the sum ( (x_i, T(x_j)) + (x_k, T(x_l)) ) to using the norm of the difference ( (x_i, T(x_j)) - (x_k, T(x_l)) ), i.e., a sign flip in the diameter definition.
